198656.description:
From the publisher:

Battleaxe was the first really serious British attempt to relieve the beleaguered fortress of Tobruk once Rommel's Afrika Korps had invested it. Operation Battleaxe is both an expansion to Mare Nostrum and a standalone game in the TSWW game series, handling not just the battle itself but a few other things.... read on!

Inside the lovely Ziplock bag you will find:
1. A small map of the Tobruk area so you can play the Operation Battleaxe Module.

2. 560 superlative die cut counters, covering not just the Battleaxe forces, but the Soviet forces that invaded Iran in 1941, and the German forces Hitler wanted to invade Turkey with in 1942!

3. Rules based on the updated set in Singapore!

4. Cut back charts based on the updated set in Singapore!

5. OBs covering Operation Battleaxe at half month and 5 day scale, the Anglo-Soviet invasion of Iran (for Mare Nostrum), and the projected German Invasion of Turkey (again you need Mare Nostrum for this).

6. 2 x D10 Dice

The OB work for this game will also provide more tailored handling of the DAK and 8th Army during 1941 for all you Desert aficionados, and fills in two modules we did not have space for in Mare Nostrum whilst adding yet another one to that immense game.

The only game of the invasion of Iran, Operation Battleaxe provides another first for the TSWW series, expanding the already huge Mare Nostrum and providing you with the title battle at 2 scales in one Ziplock.
198656.name: TSWW: Operation Battleaxe

198657.name: Ghost Ship Enyo
198657.description:
Author's Summary

Six months ago, another ship controlled by Command found a enormous hundred-year-old shipwreck floating there. They reported the findings back to Command, and left the shipwreck untouched. The ship is called the Enyo, and it was long thought to have been completely destroyed in the final battle of the Similean War. Now, you are a lab tech on the spaceship, Innovation, coming to explore the Enyo. You have been instructed by command to take a crew of scientists to pilot-test a new machine designed to purify air and stabilize the environments of spaceships where the hull has been fatally breached. Rather than test this machine by crashing service ships into things, the tests of this machine are taking place on shipwrecks throughout the galaxy. This is the first time the machine, the Magnapur42, will be tested in a non-simulated shipwreck environment. The wreck has been deemed safe, and you and some other team-members have come aboard. This is an out-loud text-adventure game, created in the tradition of the ones that people used to play on their computers. This is an adaptation of this genre, designed and tested for use with a group of people instead of a computer. Content warnings for this game include: violence, mental illness, suicide, family separation, and fictional religiosity. Recommended for ages 16+.

198660.name: Almas, Sweet Almas Episode I: The Kaluthin are Always Greener
198660.description:
From Introduction:

Something is rotten on the planet Almas. The home of the Jedi Academy has always been a place of mysterious happenings; however, the current problem could affect the very existence of the world and dramatically change the balance of power and justice in the system... Play before Desert Cries and A Dark Fortress. An adventure for Living Force heroes levels 1-9.

198661.name: Almas, Sweet Almas Episode II: Desert Cries
198661.description:
From Introduction:

In the place where Kibh Jeen fell victim to the dark side, others have begun to be lost as well. It seems that the problem with the kaluthin on Almas was only the beginning. An adventure for Living Force heroes levels 1-9. It is strongly recommended that this be played after The Kaluthin Are Always Greener and before A Dark Fortress.

198662.name: Almas, Sweet Almas Episode III: A Dark Fortress
198662.description:
From Introduction:

The search for a lost Padawan takes the heroes of Cularin to places they had never seen - nor ever hoped to see. An adventure for Living Forces heroes levels 1-9. It is strongly recommended that you play this adventure after The Kaluthin are Always Greener and Desert Cries.

198663.name: Coruscani Dawn
198663.description:
From Introduction:

An ancient artifact of the Sith has been uncovered beneath the wasteland of Almas, and it needs to get to Coruscant now. A veritable fleet of ships has been organized for the mission, and the heroes of Cularin have quite a journey ahead of them. Coruscant awaits! An adventure for Living Force heroes level 1-9.

198664.name: Below the Belt Episode I: Philanthropy
198664.description:
From Introduction:

Opportunities about when the asteroids belt is opened up for exploration by the Smuggler's Confederation. Asked to participate in this historic occasion by someone in need of a favor, you'll soon learn the rewards of philanthropy...or its terrible price. An adventure for Living Force heroes level 1-9.

198665.name: Below the Belt Episode II: Philosophy
198665.description:
From Introduction:

Exploration of the asteroid belt is still going strong, with claim staking and new discoveries every day. All at once, part of this wild, new frontier seems to vanish. Something or someone is casting dark shadows over part of the asteroid belt and unless you can solve the "riddles in the dark," shadows are only the beginning... This is best played after Philanthropy and before Philology and is suitable for heroes level 1-9. This scenario features intense role-playing, and is recommended for mature players.

198666.name: Below the Belt Episode III: Philology
198666.description:
From Introduction:

Individuals have gone missing in the asteroid belt before, but when the individual is Len Markus, even Nirama begins to worry. Anything that can harm Len is a threat to the entire system - are the heroes of Cularin up to a search-and-rescue mission?. An adventure for Living Force heroes levels 1-9. This must be played after Philanthropy and Philosophy.

198667.name: Strudel
198667.description: The game consists of two decks of cards and, for each player, a timer that acts like a chess or Scrabble clock. One deck is of five letter words, the other of seven letter words. The active player looks at the word at the top of a card that is drawn from the deck of his choice. The rest of the card is hidden. He then either (i) begins naming the word's anagrams that may be hidden on the card, or (ii) says "Strudel" if he believes the word has no anagrams. He tips his timer to its side when he is finished naming anagrams or when he says Strudel and then re-starts it on his next turn. Players advance on a score track for each anagram they name and for each correct Strudel. They are penalized for incorrect Strudels. The winner is the first to the end of the score track or the furthest along when the timers all have run out.

198668.name: Top Hats And Treachery
198668.description:
From the publisher:

Top Hats And Treachery (T.H.A.T. for short) is a tongue-in-cheek Victorian game of social climbing, wicked misadventure and ridiculously-fun story-telling! Created by Andrew Prowse and presented from Rogue Artist Creations Ltd.

YOU control a fashionable piece of real estate in Old London Town. Your goal is to rent rooms to the BEST clientele with the FINEST reputations. Each turn, you play Rumours cards to enhance your own Guests' reputations, while whispering scandalous stories about rival hotels' Guests to ruin their repuatations and ensure that your Hotel comes out on top!

Players start the game with an Upper Class, Middle Class and Lower Class character. Over the game, they play Event Cards to raise and lower the target characters' Reputationsn. Play positive cards on your own characters and negative ones on your rivals. Play Grim Reaper cards to kill off characters; whereupon they are replaced with new ones, but the players can sacrifice cards to gain a chance of getting a higher-class replacement. At the end of a (short/long) game, total all the points and modifiers: the player with the highest total has earned Queen Victoria's favour as the finest Hotel in the land and wins! Huzzah!

198669.name: Global Ranking
198669.description:
Players vote for one of three countries that that they think best fits the category showing on the spinner, and are awarded tokens for correct picks. To win the game, players must be the first with 10 tokens.

Global Ranking draws on a player's memory of facts or ability to logically eliminate countries that do not fit the spinner category to increase odds that a guess will be a successful.

Features:
Geography Facts
Demographic Information
Comparisons

198670.name: Kings of War 2nd Edition
198670.description:
Since ancient times, the world has been ravaged by war. The wise foresee an age of horror approaching, for the spirit of the earth is sick, tainted by deadly sorcery in a great conflict ages past. Not that the warlords of this bloody era care, not while there is glory to be won, territory to be wrested from the enemy, foes to be slaughtered.

Kings of War 2nd Edition is a hardback rulebook that contains the complete Kings of War history and rules. It features:
- Rules written by Alessio Cavatore (Warhammer 40,000, Bolt Action) and the Mantic Rules Committee. Kings of War is a game for gamers, by gamers.
- Compelling new background, art and photography that invoke a powerful realm of swords and sorcery.
- Elegant easy-to-learn rules, balanced and playtested by the community for casual and tournament play.
- New Magic Spells and Artefacts
- Eleven Force Lists upgraded with new units, including Forces of the Abyss, Forces of Nature, Undead, Dwarfs, Elves, Abyssal Dwarfs, Goblins, Orcs, Ogres, Basileans and the Kingdoms of Men.

Kings of War is the miniatures wargame from Mantic Games. Designed to go along with the accompanying 28mm Fantasy Ranges the game features players maneuvering large blocks of miniature soldiers around the battlefield in search of victory.

Kings of War is a new concept for mass battle miniature wargaming — a game that is both easy to learn and fast to play! With few and simple rules, there is little to get in the way of the fun and slaughter. Kings of War is a challenging game of strategy, where you can pit your wits against your opponent without devoting half of your brain power to remember a plethora of convoluted rules.

And that’s not all, the innovative turn structure allows you to play Kings of War using a time-keeping tool (like a stopwatch or a chess clock) to time your moves. As the seconds tick away, the pressure and excitement this adds makes 'Kings of War' unlike any other large-scale wargame you’ve ever played before.

Units are given simple ratings such as 'Melee Attack', 'Defense' and 'Nerve' and then augmented with special abilities that characterize the different fantasy races that inhabit the world. In 2012, the "beta" rules were updated and a full ruleset was released. Abbreviated rules are downloadable from Mantic's website, and extracts (about 70%) from the full army lists for many factions are also available for download. Currently army lists exist for Elves, Dwarves, Kingdom of Men (Medieval Humans), Basileans (Clerical army with saints and angels), Abyssal (evil) Dwarves, Goblins, Orcs, Ogres, Twilight Kin (evil elves) and the Undead hordes.
An expansion includes the complete Ogre army list, while additional faction lists are now available in the "Uncharted Empires" supplement: The Brotherhood, Salamander (humanoid lizards) Armies, The Herd (satyrs... ok: beast-men), The League of Rhordia (fantasy renaissance humans), The Trident Realms of Neritica (tritons/fishmen), The Empire of Dust (aegyptian undeads... yes, kings from tombs), Night-Stalker Armies (spirits, ghosts and the like), Ratkin Armies (ska... er, scavenger ratmen) and the Varangur (chao...tic warriors).

198671.description:
Stand together to Protect the Pride Lands

Fearsome foes from the shadowy outlands are closing in and you must work as a team to fend them off! Race to get Kion to the top of pride rock so he can unleash the power of the Roar and save the day!

Protect the Pride Lands is a cooperative family board game based on the Disney Junior show "The Lion Guard". It includes four high quality hero miniatures, 15 unique "outlander" standees and is played on a board with 3-D features. Outlanders (hyenas, snakes and vultures) invade the Pride Lands from different locations while the Lion Guard heroes race to remove them from the board.

Each turn, a player draws from the deck and adds an outlander creature to the board as pictured in the top half of the card. Then a choice is given to the player to move one of two heroes, as shown on the bottom half of the card, up to a number of spaces listed. If a hero lands on a space with an outlander, the outlander is removed from the board. There are also "Power Cards" that provide a bonus effect, such as removing any one outlander from the board.

The goal of the game is to move Kion to the top of "Pride Rock" before the outlanders get to their winning space. Otherwise the Pride Lands have been invaded and the players lose.
198671.name: The Lion Guard: Protect the Pride Lands

198672.name: Blockbusters Question Master

videogameversion.309067: English / European BBC Micro & Electron Cassette edition

198672.description:
From the inlay:

QUESTIONMASTER from Macsen Software is a follow on to the BLOCKBUSTERS cassette, which is a computer game based on the well known television series of the same name. The TV game is a Central Production made in association with Mark Goodson and Talbot Television.
QUESTIONMASTER allows the setting of questions and answers for the BLOCKBUSTERS game, and it is therefore essential to have a copy of the BLOCKBUSTERS in order to take advantage of this cassette.

User Summary

This expansion tape provides 500 additional questions for Blockbusters. It also provides a quiz editor which allows the user to create and save their own question packs to tape.
This expansion was available by mail order through a form in the inlay of the original Blockbusters game.

198673.name: Blockbusters Extra Question Database
198673.description:
From the inlay:

There are three sets of questions on this tape each one containing hundreds of questions.

User Summary

This tape contained additional questions for the Commodore 16 version of Blockbusters. Unlike Blockbusters Question Master released for other formats, this version does not include a question editor.
This expansion was available by mail order through a form in the inlay of the original Blockbusters game.

198674.name: Crawling Under A Broken Moon (Issue 12 - Apr 2016)

rpg.10737: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

198674.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Welcome to the 12th issue of Crawling Under A Broken Moon, a fanzine dedicated to bringing gonzo post apocalyptic content for the Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG from Goodman Games.

This issue contains:

The lore of Buddy O’Burger, the beneficent burger god of Feasting, Customer Service, and Cannibalism

Full deity and patron information including patron spells

Cult organization and restaurant data

A new class for those blessed by the gloved hand of Buddy

Descriptions of Buddy’s hench-creatures and servants

And much, much more!

198675.name: Crawling Under A Broken Moon (Issue 13 - June 2016)

rpg.10737: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

198675.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Welcome to the 13th issue of Crawling Under A Broken Moon, a fanzine dedicated to bringing gonzo post apocalyptic content for the Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG from Goodman Games.

This issue contains:

the Fantastic Post-Apocalyptic Adventure Idea Generator

An Interesting Place to Die: The Rail Tunnels of the Delphia Beast

Racial Recast: An alternative Elf class

A Death Bots creation guide

And much, much more!

198676.name: Darkmoor
198676.description:
From the publisher website:
Darkmoor is a Role Playing Game inspired by the Blackmoor Mobile Game by Mooff Games, therefore you'll live incredible adventures in a totally crazy and funny fantasy setting with weird elements.

198677.name: Real Life Superhero/Real Life Villain
198677.description:
From the publisher website:
Cosa ci spinge ad indossare una maschera?
Dietro una maschera possiamo sbarazzarci dei freni inibitori.
Ignorare l'assillante voce della nostra coscienza.
Smettere di confrontraci con i nostri limiti.
Scrollarci di dosso le imposizioni della società con cui non riusciamo a convivere.
Diventare persone migliori.
English translation:
Why we wear a mask?
Behind a mask we can get rid of inhibitions.
Ignore the nagging voice of our conscience.
Forget our limits.
Shake off the impositions of society with which we can not live with.
Become better people.

198678.name: Musha Shugyo: La Via del Guerriero
198678.description:
From the back of the box:
Musha Shugyo è il gioco di combattimenti che ti terrà incollato al tavolo. All’interno troverai dieci combattenti pronti per giocare subito, ma potrai crearne quanti ne vorrai grazie alle semplici regole. Affronta i tuoi amici in singoli scontri, tornei o vini assieme a loro emozionanti avventure. Con Musha Shugyo le possibilità sono infinite!

English translation:
Musha Shugyo is the fighting game will keep you glued to the table. Within you'll find ten ready ti fight characters, but you'll also findsimple rules to create your own heroes. Fight against your friends in a single match play, tournaments or live exciting adventures with them. With Musha Shugyo you'll have endless possibilities!

198679.name: Set of 10 Printed PCs for Darkmoor
198679.description:
User summary:

Set of 10 heavy-paper pregenerated Characters, color printed in US Letter format: ready for your demo games. Darkmoor’s Map + Technical Sheet with a summery of all Darkmoor’s rules is included too, for a total of 11 color sheets.

198680.name: Where on Earth?
198680.description: The planet-sized game of famous places & landmarks! On every card there's a location and 5 key clues that help reveal it's whereabouts... the quicker you can solve them the better you'll do!

198681.name: Shooting Stars!
198681.description:
Shooting Stars is a mobile shoot 'em up with roguelike elements from the Vienna based indie studio Bloodirony Games. It's all about evil aliens, superstars, cats and rainbow lazers.

Aliens have secretly conquered the earth and replaced all the famous pop-culture superstars by installing evil marionettes serving one purpose only – to control all human life. The sacred rainbow unicorn made it your mission to free the imprisoned stars, fight back the evil aliens and restore the balance of entertainment on planet earth.

Source: The Developer Website.

198682.name: Bunker Zero
198682.description:
Bunker Zero is a one-shot scenario for The Front , a WWII OSR hack. This mission is designed for 2-5 player characters and only a single session. The PCs will be entering an enemy bunker complex to kill or capture a scientist.

The new secret bunker complex south of the river Neim is made of up of three bunkers, and each must be penetrated and searched for Dr Hauer who is working on the enemies new super weapon. Only the scientist is not in any of the three bunkers and he's not working on any normal weapon. There are occult powers being developed beneath the ground, real, tactile, practical, dangerous powers


Publishers blurb

198684.name: WWE Raw 2
198684.description:
"WWE Raw 2: Ruthless Aggression, known as simply WWE Raw 2, is a video game released for the Xbox console by THQ in 2003, and developed by Tokyo-based company Anchor Inc. It is the sequel to the WWE Raw game that was released in 2002.

For the first time in the series, a season mode is included in the game. It allows players to set up wrestlers, call others out from the locker room, form alliances, and hire managers. To successfully complete a season, the player is required to play through 12 months of Raw and SmackDown! shows, as well as Pay-Per-View events, and finish the season with either the WWE Championship, or the World Heavyweight Championship. Successful seasons earn points, which can be seen in the 'Hall of Fame' section of the main menu of the game, which in turn unlocks items of clothing and entrance videos which can later be used in the creation or modification of characters.

Raw 2 allows players to edit WWE's wrestlers into the way they want them to look similar to the N64 games WWF WrestleMania 2000 and WWF No Mercy.

The game features several arenas that WWE held events in during 2002 and 2003. There are also arenas based upon each WWE television show. The game also features Raw and Smackdown! referees in the game that the player can choose.

New match stipulations are included in the game: Hell in a Cell, TLC and Royal Rumble matches are available in Raw 2.

Upon its release, the game was praised for an improved and more current roster. The game received 'average' reviews according to video game review aggregator Metacritic. Many praised the creation modes, but criticized the gameplay."

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WWE_Raw_2 WWE Raw 2]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

198685.name: Herr Kompositor Card Game: Comporre è un gioco
198685.description:
Description from the publisher:

Herr Kompositor Card Game. A composing game allows you to enjoy the thrill of musical creation even if you don't know notes and chords. In this strategy game, you challenge your opponent, gain chords, complete your song, then listen to it!

AIM OF THE GAME
- 2 players game
Each player is a composer and has to compose a song of 16 bars before the opponent. Any direct fight with his/her opponent, if won, gives a player the right to draw one or more cards and win (or lose) one or more bars. The player who finishes all 16 bars first is the winner.
- 1 player game
Do you want to write the best love song ever? Or do you want to become the greatest composer in the world? Each time you play, you will compose a new song in AAA, ABA, AAB, ABAA form... You have no limits!

Components


56 cards
Rules (in italian / in english: downloadable from http://bit.ly/28MUkG3)
Videotutorials (in italian: http://bit.ly/28LfPIv)

198686.name: Splashdown: Rides Gone Wild
198686.description:
"Splashdown: Rides Gone Wild %28also known as Splashdown 2: Rides Gone Wild in Europe%29 is a PlayStation 2 sequel to the original Splashdown for the PlayStation 2 and Xbox%2E The game features a career mode where winning races gives the player points which can be used to upgrade items or buy new ones%2E It also features arcade, training and multiplayer modes%2E"

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Splashdown%3A_Rides_Gone_Wild Splashdown: Rides Gone Wild]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

198687.name: The Lost Artifact
198687.description:
Publisher Blurb:
The Lost Artifact is a role-playing game for two players that will catapult you into timeless adventures in search of the old relics and artifacts of antiquity.

You will be the archaeologist that, after the discovery of evidence to the existence of an ancient artifact, start an adventur to his research, not for money, fortune or glory, but in order to expose it to a museum where it can be admired by the whole human populations, or to bring him to safety in a warehouse and protect it from the wrong hands.

With you we will be your trusted and inseparable assistant who will follow you ends of the earth, but along the way you will find traps and enemies to face and old friendships to rediscover.

The game is for two players, with a system of shared development of the adventure, that allows both players to outline the history and adventure and the game system, simple and intuitive, will handle situations of danger and suspense quickly, keeping the game more on a narrative style without having to do so many dice rolls and calculations to determine the success or failure of the actions of the characters.

198688.name: L'artefatto Perduto
198688.description:
Publisher Blurb:
L'Artefatto Perduto è un gioco di ruolo per due giocatori che vi catapulterà in avventure senza tempo, alla ricerca delle vecchie reliquie e artefatti dell'antichità.
Voi sarete l'Archeologo che dopo il ritrovamento di prove e indizzi sull'esistenza di un antico artefatto partirà alla sua ricerca, non per soldi, fortuna o gloria, ma con lo scopo di esporlo in un museo dove potrà essere ammirato da l'intera popolazione umana o per portarlo in salvo in un magazzino e proteggerlo dalle mani sbagliate. Con voi ci sarà il vostro fidato e inseparabile Assistente che vi accompagnerà anche in capo al mondo, ma lungo la strada troverete pericoli e nemici da affrontare e vecchie amicizie da ritrovare.
Il gioco è per due giocatori, con un sistema di sviluppo dell'avventura condivisa, cioè che permette ad entrambi i giocatori di delineare la storia e l'avventura.
Durante l'avventura l'archeologo e il suo assistente,incontreranno tanti pericoli e difficoltà da superare; il sistema di gioco semplice e intuitivo permetterà di gestire le situazioni di pericolo e suspance in modo veloce mantenendo il gioco più su uno stile narrativo e libero, senza dover fare tanti tiri di dadi e calcoli per determinare il successo o il fallimento delle azioni dei personaggi.

198689.name: RONIN
198689.description:
Source: The Game Website.

Ronin is stylish a turn-based action platformer following the exploits of a vengeful heroine determined to strike down five prominent figures of a powerful corporation. Move with precision by meticulously planning out each silent step, soaring leap, and devastating swing of your blade from the shadows as you seek your revenge.

198690.description:
From the publisher:
Arrr!!! is a non-collectible card game in which players compete against each other, taking the role of pirate captains, gaining fame and wealth while facing perils in the Seven Seas.
In order to gain fame and money players must face quests in the shape of Exploration cards. To win these quests player use their Crew, wich tell how many dices to use. Money can be used to "cheat", giving the player 2 more dices. When there are no more Exploration cards, the game end. the player with most fame and money wins.

From the publisher (Italian):
Arrr!!! è un gioco di carte non collezionabile in cui i giocatori competono tra loro vestendo i panni di Capitani Pirata il cui scopo è accumulare fama e ricchezza affrontando insidie nei Sette Mari. Per guadagnare fama e dobloni i giocatori devono affrontare avventure, rappresentate dalle carte Esplorazione. Per fare ciò il giocatore necessita di un equipaggio, il quale determina quanti dadi lanciare. I Dobloni possono essere usati per "barare", dando al giocatore 2 dadi in più da lanciare. Quando non ci sono più carte Esplorazione il gioco finisce e chi ha più fama e ricchezza, è il vincitore
198690.name: Arrr!!!

198691.name: Star Wars: Top Trumps Tournament
198691.description: Six packs of Star Wars Top Trumps cards are placed around a spinner on a central Hub. Players each have a scorebar with 9 peg holes. Players take turns to spin the spinner to determine which action should be taken between 4 mini games, the victor winning a certain number of pegs, or straight up aquiring pegs. If a mini game is chosen then the player spins again to select which pack should be used if necessary. The first player to fill their score bar with 9 pegs is the winner. The Six packs included are episodes I-III; episodes IV-VI; starships; clone wars; the clone wars; top 30 moments.

198692.name: Sticks & Stunts
198692.description:
The game comes with 15 stunt sticks in each of six colors, a deck of cards with one of eight activities displayed on each card, 16 tokens numbered one through 16, and, for each player (or team), a 4X4 board with spaces numbered one through 16.
At the beginning of each round, a token is flipped face-up, a card is drawn, and all players (or teams) then try to complete the activity shown on the card. Successful players place a marker on the space on their boards that corresponds to the number on the token. The first player to place four in a row wins.
Activities involve the sticks in some way, usually by building structures that don't fall or that are produced from memory or instruction or that others try to guess. A few activities use the sticks differently, eg, to indicate answers to trivia questions or to prompt Liar's Dice-style guessing.

198693.name: Dino-Zug Alle einsteigen!
198693.description:
Dinostarkes Laufspiel

A simple children's game with a color die for ages 4 and up, themed to Jim Henson's "Dinosaur Train".

A simple card-based game, where dice and playing-wheel are only used to determine which cards can be placed on the table by all players. First player to place all cards wins.

198695.name: To Make a Dollar
198695.description: To Make a Dollar is an economic game that is meant to teach kids about managing their money, making a profit, and the concept of supply and demand. The player is tasked with buying fruit when the price is low and selling when the price is high. Each fruit only has a shelf life of 7 days before it expires so they must decide if they are willing to risk waiting for the perfect selling price or if they need to settle for a smaller profit margin. The player with the most money at the end of the game is the winner.

198696.name: Looking In Episode I: Outward Bound
198696.description:
From Introduction:

Renna - of Renna's Transport Services - is in need of some help. One of her freighters has disappeared carrying valuable cargo. She suspects the notorious pirate gang known as the Brotherhood may be involved. A Living Force scenario for heroes level 4 to 12. It is strongly recommended that this scenario be played before The Air Up Thaere and Memories.

Note: If you have not played Philology this scenario contains significant spoilers.

198697.name: NHL All About Trivia Card Game
198697.description: NHL All About Trivia Card Game is a travel-sized edition of the board game by the same name. It includes cards with 250 trivia questions and is officially endorsed by the NHL.

198698.name: Natsuyasumi Daisakusen
198698.description:
User summary
夏休み大作戦 (Natsuyasumi Daisakusen) translates to English as "Operation Summer Holiday".

Operation Summer Holiday is a bidding game that consists of two stages with different bidding rules. As a schoolkid, you make a picture diary about what you have experienced with your friends during your summer vacation.

The first stage is the First Trimester. You bid for Friend Cards using their Vitality Chips. The second stage is Summer Vacation. You bid for Diary Pages using your Friend Cards.

When the Summer Vacation is over, it is checked to see if you have completed your homework. You can't neglect studying even during vacation. Your Diary Pages constitute your own diary that describes summer events you have experienced, such as going to the beach, camping, fireworks, insect collecting, and most of all, your friends who share the memories.

Each page gives you some victory points, and the player who wrote the most pages gains bonus points. The highest scorer is the winner, who enjoyed the summer vacation most.

Publisher's description
「夏休み大作戦」は前半と後半でルールの異なる競りを行う2段階の競りのゲームです。プレイヤーは友達との夏休みの思い出を絵日記に綴ります。
前半の「一学期フェイズ」では手持ちの「元気チップ」を使って「友達カード」を獲得します。
後半の「夏休みフェイズ」では前半で獲得した「友達カード」を使って「日記カード」を獲得します。
後半の競りが終わると夏休みの宿題を済ませたかチェックが入ります。夏休みを満喫することも大事ですが勉強を疎かにしてはいけません。
海、キャンプ、花火、肝試し、虫捕り、様々な楽しみ……　そして何よりも一緒に過ごした友達との思い出！　たくさんの絵日記を描いたプレイヤーはボーナス点の「はなまるチップ」を獲得します。最も多くの得点を得たプレイヤーが夏休みを最高に楽しんだプレイヤーになります。

198699.name: Docchi no Shimatsu Show
198699.description:
User summary
どっちの始末Show (Docchi no Shimatsu Show) translates into English as "Apology Showdown".

About 150 years have passed since the end of Edo period, and with emergence of civilization, Harakiri ended its role as a method of expressing apology. However, Japanese habit of apologizing is still alive over generations, and a new method of apologizing is invented, which is called Shimatsusho (Letter of Apology).

A Shimatsusho is created through a magical ritual in which you inscribe lengthy and complicated magic words onto a sheet of A4-sized paper, in order that you never cause such a disaster again.

Apology Showdown is a card game in which you, as a mid-level manager of a company, hand out a Shimatsusho to your boss. You lose the game if you can't get rid of most critical Shimatsusho. You should report the most urgent Shimatsusho first. With countless troubles, your boss won't accept less urgent Shimatsusho. As a competent business person, you know which one you should hand out first.

Publisher's summary
江戸幕府の終焉から150年。文明開化とともに日本社会からハラキリが姿を消しましたが、謝ることをDNAに刻んでいる日本人はそれに代わる新たな贖罪のメソッドを生み出しました。それが始末書(Shimatsusho)です。これはA4のコピー用紙に超大で複雑な呪文を綴ることで災厄の再発を防ごうとする魔術の一種です。
「どっちの始末Show」は始末書を上司に提出するトリックテイキングゲームです。危険な始末書を最後まで提出せずに抱えていたプレイヤーがゲームに敗北します。
緊急度の高い始末書は早めに報告するのが社会人の嗜み。しかし、トラブルに忙殺される上司は緊急度の低い始末書を容易に受け取ってはくれません。
ならば先に提出しなければならない始末書はどっちなのか……？　優秀な中間管理職であるあなたならきっとそれが分かるはずです！

198700.description:
You are the fastest man on earth. Struck by lightning, you became a force of your own; you are Flash! Together with the other members of the Justice League, you fight against the dark villains and thwart their devious plans. Will you be able to defend your city?

With Justice League: Hero Dice – Flash, you join the Justice League as The Fastest Man Alive. Gather your friends around you, roll the dice and battle villains with your Super Speed. This game can be played on its own or in combination with one or more of the other Hero Dice sets.
198700.name: Justice League: Hero Dice – Flash

198701.description:
You have been chosen to wear the green ring. As the emerald knight, you are the defender of the universe; you are Green Lantern! Together with the other members of the Justice League, you fight against the dark villains and thwart their devious plans. Will you be able to defend OA, the home of all of the Green Lanterns?

With Justice League: Hero Dice – Green Lantern, you join the Justice League as the Emerald Gladiator. Gather your friends around you, roll the dice, and battle villains with the might of willpower. This game can be played on its own or in combination with one or more of the other Hero Dice sets.
198701.name: Justice League: Hero Dice – Green Lantern

198702.name: Blockbusters - Official Gameshow
198702.description:
From the appstore description:

THE MEMORIES: “ I’ll have a ‘P’ please Bob ”
You grew up watching Bob Holness on ITV and BBC grilling contestants and playing the Gold Run and now it is your chance! We have made every effort to replicate the look and feel of the original show….

This app includes Bob Holness, the original music and game sounds, original question content and the original title sequence.

User Summary

Blockbusters was a highly popular British TV show (though originally based on an American format) hosted by Bob Holness. Students, one single and one team of two, would compete to answer questions to fill in hexagons on a grid. Each hexagon was filled with a letter, and the answer to the question started with that letter. If a team answered a question correctly it would turn their colour (white or blue) and they could then choose the next location on the grid, leading to the famous catchphrase "Can I have a 'P' please, Bob?" (having a Pee is British slang for urinating).

The aim of the game is for the single student (playing white) to connect from top to bottom, a minimum of four spaces, and for the pair of students to connect from left to right, a minimum of five spaces.

Winning would allow the team to progress to the Gold Run, where a single student (the pair would alternate if they won multiple times) would attempt to cross a more complicated version of the board.

This version recreates the TV show in its entirety, including the music, title-sequence and sound effects. It even lets the player choose a mascot for their desk.

It can be played single-player against a computer opponent, or two-player as pass-and-play, using Bluetooth, or over the Internet.

When playing two-player, the board is switched to a 5 by 5 grid, to take account of the fact that the blue team does not have the same advantage as on the TV show.

Additional question packs are available as in-app purchases.

198703.name: Looking In Episode II: The Air Up Thaere
198703.description:
From Introduction:

A refueling stop becomes problematic when something is discovered to be wrong with the ship the heroes are piloting. Of course, there are worse places to have something go wrong than a space station in Thaere - aren't there? A Living Force scenario for heroes level 4-12. It is strongly recommended that this scenario be played after Outward Bound and before Memories.

rpg.35309: Echoes of Glory: Ruritania's World Cup 1966

198704.name: Echoes of Glory: Ruritania's World Cup 1966
198704.description:
User summary:

Characters have several Attributes, some of which have values assigned from a points pool, the remainder have values derived from modified die rolls. Generally, Attributes will have a numeric value from 7 - 10. Play involves a series of team matches with success depending largely on card plays.

Characters in the game also have an "off-pitch" goal, primarily political in nature. These are secret goals that characters would not admit to others. While the team goal - win the competition - is obvious and involves all players, these "off-pitch" goals are neither obvious nor necessarily cooperative.

The game is distributed as two PDF files, both of which are required to play the game. One is an A4 "sticker album", containing the player profile sheet, off-pitch goals and opposition statistics. The other is an A3 wall chart that forms the centerpiece of play.

Summaries and references are provided in supplementary files, as well as an A4 version of the football pitch.

198705.name: Looking In Episode III: Memories
198705.description:
From Introduction:

Old debts must be collected, but from whom? The heroes of Cularin once more return to Thaere, and find much more than they might have expected. A Living Force scenario for Heroes levels 4 to 12. It is strongly recommended that this scenario be played after Outward Bound and The Air Up Thaere.

198706.name: No Place Like Home
198706.description:
From Introduction:

Oluna Biqua has always had a reputation as a wild port of call in the Cularin system. But when all contact with the floating city goes quiet and plumes of smoke can be seen rising from its many spires, has the never ending party finally gone too far?

198707.description:
Description from the publisher:

In Hostage Negotiator: Crime Wave — a standalone expansion to the solitaire game Hostage Negotiator — each turn represents a conversation between you and a hostage taker. You play cards and roll dice to increase conversation points, decrease the threat level, and release hostages.

Hostage Negotiator: Crime Wave uses the same "hand-building" mechanism found in Hostage Negotiator that puts cards you purchase directly in your hand for next turn, but it features new Conversation Cards, new Terror Cards, new Pivotal Events, and all new Abductors — each with new rules and new demands! It can be played right out of the box and also expands the original Hostage Negotiator.

Hostage Negotiator: Crime Wave comes in a box that fits all released content for Hostage Negotiator to date with room for more.
198707.name: Hostage Negotiator: Crime Wave

198708.name: Forces of Cularin Episode I: Force Concession
198708.description:
From Introduction:

A team of builders has gone missing on Cularin, as has the first security team sent to find them. The heroes of Cularin must venture into the jungles of Cularin, to places even the Tarasin fear, to find who - or what - is responsible... A Living Force adventure for Heroes levels 1 to 9. It is strongly recommended that this scenario be played before Force Contention and Force Convention.

198710.name: Lumpy Cubes
198710.description: Each player has a set of four cubes. A card that depicts an arrangement of four cubes is drawn. The first player to match his cubes to the pattern on the card gets the card. The first player to collect three cards wins.

198711.name: Forces of Cularin Episode II: Force Contention
198711.description:
From Introduction:

Rumors are spreading on Cularin that the Jedi are out of control – that they’ve turned into nothing more than thugs with lightsabers. In the midst of the furor, a Jedi has gone missing, and with him a dangerous artifact of the Tarasin. Heroes are needed to recover both, before it’s too late for everyone. A Living Force scenario for Heroes levels 1 to 9. We strongly recommend that this scenario be played after Force Concession and before Force Convention.

198712.name: Clockworks
198712.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Villains and Vigilantes Adventure that pits the player-heroes against Shadow, an international criminal organization that is seeking control of what may be alien technology.
Shadow, an international criminal organization has gotten wind of probable alien technology in the hands of unknowing civilians. They have combined with a local syndicate to take control over these items by whatever means necessary.

198713.name: Weretigers
198713.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bite Me! Weretigers Stalks into Your Game

Solitary hunters. Criminal masterminds. Manipulators of men. Possibly the individually most powerful of lycanthropes, weretigers rule the jungle, as well as many cities.

Bite Me! Weretigers describes a race of natural shapechangers who can be savage or subtle; can dwell in cities, jungles, or the arctic tundra; can be hungry, heroic, or hedonistic, but are always in some way superior.

Contains:

Rules for creating weretiger characters using the Bite Me! lycanthrope system, including new racial traits (from Alabaster Pelt to Rakshasa Magic), archetypes (Weretiger sorcerer, Durjana inquisitor, and Silvertongue bard), and feats (from Hawk & Spit to Sabertoothed)
New weretiger spells (from ambush of tigers to silverclaw) and magic items (from the figuring of wondrous power (jade tiger) and the ring of weapon storing)
Details of weretiger life and society
Two completely statted (in both human and tiger forms) ready-to-use NPCs.

198714.name: Duke Dedrakon (Supers!)
198714.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF contains a full write up of Duke Dedrakon, a terrible despot seeking his own demise. Cursed with immortality by a secretive order, the Duke will destroy any who cross his path. Includes full stats with tactical and plot suggestions.

198715.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 5, Issue 16 - Dolovia)
198715.description:
From publisher blurb:

Packed full of great superhero fun, each issue offers a short adventure, an NPC, or some game mechanics for the Heroes Wear Masks system. While compatible with the HWM system, you can always use the information presented in each issue for other superhero games—just monkey around with the stats and mechanics to fit the system you are using.

This week: Not all nations want your super-help—such is the closed-off nation of Dolovia.

198716.name: Rho-Aglaci Research Station
198716.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are few that call the barren ice-world of Rho-Aglaci home, but the scientists that live and work at the Rho-Aglaci Research Station certainly do. Isolated from the nearest military outpost by over 700km, the facility is self-contained and self-sufficient, and the isolation gives the team plenty of time to focus on their work. However, when they find something trapped in the ice, the extreme isolation perhaps isn't the best situation to be in.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/skirmish game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 sci-fi map depicting an a research station on a frozen ice planet. Night has fallen, the exterior lights are on, and the research station is alone. Living quarters, locker rooms, bedrooms, workrooms and laboratories make up the main facility, although there is also a landing platform outside and a transmitter room reached by a stretch of steps that lead up a frozen cliff.

198717.name: In The Company of Unicorns
198717.description:
From publisher blurb:

Always be yourself. Unless you can be a Unicorn!

Don’t be the last unicorn to join the party. Level up as a unicorn and grow from a foal to a Large mare or stallion as you embrace your untamable immortal essence and impale your foes with your horn; slay lions and dragons; disappear, change shape, or enhance yourself with the magic of your alicorn.

Create the unicorn you want to play in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game while avoiding the pit falls of vanity and pride inherent to the perfect, immortal, and utterly superior nature of unicorns. This product includes the new unicorn race the re’em, racial traits, alternate racial traits, the core class archetype (which works with 28 different classes), the unicorn sorcerous bloodline, the paragon racial class (where you level up as a unicorn), and unicorn only feats. All so, you can play unicorns alongside any other player character in any high fantasy campaign setting.

198719.name: Pillars of Glass
198719.description:
From publisher blurb:

The site dates from at least the Bednálljan period, and may be connected with the Pariah God known as the One Other. It consists of a circle of crystalline spires, some of which have fallen (similar to Stone- henge on Earth, but with columns of natural crystal rather than crude stone monoliths). The opening to the underworld beneath reveals a circular stairway leading down into a labyrinth. It is said that at the bottom of the labyrinth is a great cavern that is filled with molten lava...

Suitable for 4-6 player characters with approximately 16 earned experience and 1 earned Advantage Point apiece. Includes 6 illustrations and 3 maps!

198721.name: Crisis in Eastern Europe: Transnistrian Insurrection
198721.description: This is the Second game planned to come out for our Modern Crisis Line of games. In Transnistrian Insurrection up to four players can take on the roles of the commanders of either; Transnistria/Russia, Moldova/Romania, Belarus, or the Ukraine. They will be fighting for control of the old Soviet sphere of influence as the Moldova/Romania your main goal will be to take out the break away nation of Transnistria before the Russian Army can break through the Ukraine to help them. The game works in phases where each player will switch off and have good opportunities to counter attack and stand there ground when need be. The game also uses an interest damage chit pulling system to simulate the unexpected nature of modern combat. This is a deep war-game that can make you think about the real possibilities of a war like this in the very near future.

198723.name: Forces of Cularin Episode III: Force Convention
198723.description:
From Introduction:

A meeting aboard "The Luxury," a liner housing a pacifist group that has come to Cularin to discuss matters with the Jedi, threatens to turn very ugly, very quickly. You have proven your worth to Lanius Qel-Bertuk in the past, and now he needs your help. A Living Force scenario for Heroes levels 1 to 9. We strongly recommend that this scenario be played after Force Concession and Force Contention.

198724.name: Twi'light Storm
198724.description:
From Introduction:

Master Devan of the Almas Jedi Academy needs a group of heroes to travel to the Twi'lek home planet of Ryloth, find a Jedi Master in self-imposed exile, and convince him to return to Almas. Should be easy, right? A Living Force adventure for heroes levels 1 to 9.
Warning: Contains spoilers for the [Forces of Cularin] trilogy, and is best played after those events.

198725.name: Metatheran Caution Episode I: Caaried Away
198725.description:
From Introduction:

The mines of Tilnes have never been the safest of places, but when the heroes of Cularin find themselves embroiled in what turns out to be a very non-routine stopover, things go from bad to worse. An adventure for Living Force heroes levels 1-9. It is strongly recommended that this scenario be played before Open Aarms and Belly of the Beaast.

198726.name: Puffy's Saga
198726.description:
From the inlay:

"Don't get puffed out..."

That's the challenge in this addictive arcade-style game. You are Puffy... Your girlfriend is Puffyn. The two of you are trapped in an Alien World, where you must travel through mazes and face numerous enemies. Your only chance of survival is to solve clues that will help you discover weapons and escapade [sic] deadly hidden traps. Hear the digitized voices of Puffy and Puffyn and face blood-chilling sounds from the dark recesses of the maze.


Explore twenty different levels and settings, each offering secret passageways filled with demons.



Race through the mazes quickly or accumulate points by exploring each level in full.



Enjoy the colorful graphics and entertaining sound effects.



Choose your character: Puffy is powerful but Puffyn has the speed!



Avoid the enemies... Ghosts, Acid Puddles, Flying Dragons, and Snakes lurk around each corner.


User Summary

Puffy's Saga is highly reminiscent of the arcade classic Gauntlet (1985).

Most versions could be played only single player, allowing the selection of Puffy or Puffyn. The Amiga version allows two players simultaneously and also allows the players to switch characters mid-game.

198727.name: Metatheran Caution Episode II: Open Aarms
198727.description:
From Introduction:

Trouble has long followed the Metatheran Cartel, but will it follow them to the production facilities on Ipsus? Of course, if it did, how bad could it be? After all, that’s only where thermal detonators are constructed. An adventure for Living Force heroes levels 1-9. It is strongly recommended that this scenario be played after Caaried Away and before Belly of the Beaast.

198728.name: Metatheran Caution Episode III: Belly of the Beaast
198728.description:
From Introduction:

The galaxy is a big place, and even with hyperspace travel there are planets that almost no one ever visits. Based on information found on Ipsus, that may need to change; at least one planet may be moving off the “never visited” list. When the Cularin Militia calls for assistance, will the heroes answer? An adventure for Living Force heroes levels 1-9. This scenario should be played after Caaried Away and Open Aarms.

198729.name: Wii Game Party 3
198729.description:
Back of the Box

Contains the following 19 games that can be played by one, by up to four in local multiplayer, and tournament mode for large parties.

Beanbags
Billiards
Bounce Ball
Bumper Pool
Croquet
Darts
Hoop Shoot
Horseshoes
Lawn Darts
Miniature Golf
Ping Cup
Puck Bowling
QB Challenge
Racquetball
Rootbeer Tapper
Shuffleboard
Skill Ball
Smack-A-Troll
Trivia

198730.name: Kue: The Magic of Nines
198730.description: Ninety-nine number tiles (eleven each of numbers zero through eight) are placed in Scrabble fashion onto a 13X13 grid. Each player plays from and replenishes a rack of six tiles, placing some or all of those tiles in a straight line so that they intersect or extend an existing line of tiles in the grid. The tiles in each line affected by the play must add up to zero or to a multiple of nine. The player scores a point for each multiple of nine and for each occurrence of zero in the affected lines. Placing on premium squares enhances scoring. The game ends when no tiles are left to draw, and one player has emptied his rack.

198731.name: Faerie Clash
198731.description:
User summary:

Character creation in this competitive game involves random card draws. Each card has a variety of information, including an Attribute, a "Stat" Bonus, a Flaw, a "Stat" Penalty, an Ability, and a Question. These cards are required for play but they are not provided in the game. A separate download correlates the card data to the arcana of a standard Tarot deck.

Players gain "glitter" and experience points during play. Experience points may be spent to improve characters. Accumulating glitter is the goal of the game, and characters primarily gain glitter by stealing it from other characters (the main activity of the game).

198732.name: Faerie Clash: Character Guide
198732.description:
User summary:

The Character Guide is a simple Excel spreadsheet that lists twenty-four Tarot deck arcana and correlates them to game values. This allows a Tarot deck to be used in place of the (non-existent) specialized game cards. Each card has these values defined:


Title
Attribute
Stat Bonus
Flaw
Stat Penalty
Ability
Question

198733.name: Spirits of the Wild
198733.description:
From the introduction:

You and I are spirits of the wild
...
We have glimpsed a dark future

User summary:

The game is a video file (only). Characters in the game believe in some impending doom, and seek to warn others. Characters are unable to speak or write, however, and may communicate only with pictures. Ironically, the game rules are conveyed as pictures of writing. By any standard, this must be considered an experimental and avant-garde roleplaying game.

198734.name: A Tragedy Unfolds
198734.description:
From the introduction:

The player characters have put into a tropical island for repairs to their ship. But the local village is almost deserted, and the jungle hides a secret this is both terrible and tragic. Can the player characters put to right something so foul that it seems there can be no redemption?

User summary:

For four 2nd level characters.

198735.name: Let's Go Digging
198735.description:
Players are archaeologists digging in rural areas and working together to unearth artifacts from different historical periods.

A dig area is formed in the center of the table by creating a tableau of face-down cards in 4 rows of 6 overlapping cards. Only the top card of each row is available for play action. Players are then dealt a hand of action cards that allow them to move cards in the tableau, search the dig field, dig in one column of the field, or transfer cards to the collection site (in a separate area). "No Trespassing" cards will block digging in a particular column and force a player to play a (limited quantity) "Permit" card in order to access any artifacts locked above that card.

The game ends when the 15th artifact or dirt sample card has been moved to the Collection Site or when players are blocked from moving any more cards. Players count how many complete collections (groups of 3 cards representing the same historical period)they have managed to gather.

198736.name: Police Precinct:  ONLINE
198736.description:
In 2013 the board-game known as Police Precinct ONLY came in cardboard form, BUT in 2016 that all changed. Now you can get it in digital form too (available in both iOS and Android as a pure co-op -- Dirty Cop available in cardboard only).

The award winning game is widely recognized for being one of the most highly thematic cooperative boardgames of all time.

Police Precinct utilizes real cops for consultants, contains real cops for characters, and is used to train real cops!

Based on 2nd Edition artwork.

Multiple games can be played and saved all at the same time.

Six primary difficulty levels (from Rookie up to Chief) and thousands of additional custom levels.

Can play in either Pass-and-Play mode or Online mode.

PASS-AND-PLAY:
within this mode players can start solo games controlling 2-6 players, or play with a group of friends (in person).

ONLINE:
Within this mode players can create games and invite others to join in. These games can be played in real-time OR asynchronously. In fact games can be conducted in a combination of real-time (during certain phases of the game) AND asynchronous (at other phases of the game -- as players wish -- all in the same game session!).

Source: The Publisher Website.

198737.name: Order of Battle: Pacific
198737.description:
Set in Pacific theater of WW2, Order of Battle: Pacific features playable campaigns for both the US-led Allies and the Japanese Empire. Starting from the attack on Pearl Harbor, the dynamic campaign system allows players to alter the course of history and even win the war as Japan in the fictional “what-if” conquest of Australia, or lead the Allied forces from the struggle at the beginning of the war to ultimate victory with the invasion of Japan.

With a selection of over 500 unique looking and behaving units, players can build and manage their army and fleet throughout the campaign. Early units include the iconic M3 Stuart, Type 97 Chi-Ha, A6M Zero and F4U Corsair fighters. As new technology becomes available, players eventually gain access to high-tech and prototype units such as the Nakajima Kikka and P-80 Shooting Star jet-fighters, Montana and Super Yamato Class battleships and T28, T29 and Type 100 I/O heavy tanks.

A unique system of Specializations allows players to customize their forces with special units, bonuses and abilities that reflect the difference in strategies and mentality of the opposing sides. Focus on the merciless Japanese fighting spirit with Banzai Charge and Bushido Code, establish supply advantages with the Tokyo Express, or gain access to B29 Nuclear Bombers through the Manhattan Project.

Source: The Publisher Website.


The game was originally released as Order of Battle: Pacific on April 30, 2015 and included what are now the Rising Sun and U.S. Pacific DLCs. On June 14, 2016, the game was renamed to Order of Battle: World War II and became free to play, with the two original campaigns becoming DLC.

198738.name: Order of Battle: Morning Sun
198738.description:
Order of Battle: Morning Sun is an expansion of Order of Battle: Pacific and requires the base game to be played.

In summer 1937, renewed tensions between Japan and China escalate into open war: The Second Sino-Japanese war has begun.

Order of Battle: Pacific after the release of the successful free update Battle of Britain, comes back to the Pacific Theatre, covering one of the cruellest but most underrated conflicts of the Second World War period.

In Order of Battle: Morning Sun players take control over the Japanese forces fighting for territorial expansion and rich Chinese resources. The conflict soon turns into a massive all-out war between the two sides during the Battle of Shanghai. While the Chinese forces are numerically superior, they have suffered from internal conflict and are poorly equipped with outdated weapons. The recently modernised Japanese Army, on the other hand, is well trained and experienced, but as the war drags on it gets increasingly overstretched, allowing the enemy to regain the initiative at several occasions...

New units

Japanese armies have been reinforced with several new units including biplane fighters and bombers such as the Ki-10, D1A and A4N1, the Sōkō Sagyō Ki flamethrower-equipped engineering vehicle and Type 89 medium tanks. The Chinese rely heavily on foreign arms deals, resulting in a diverse arsenal made up from Soviet Polikarpov fighters, Tupolev bombers and T-26 tanks, German Panzer I's, Sdkfz 221/222 armoured cars and 37mm PaK guns, Italian L3/33 tankettes, British Gloster Gladiators and many more. Nations now also have access to Cavalry units and Horse Transportation for towed guns. In total, almost 100 new unit types have been added to the game.

Scenarios

Beiping-Tianjin
Operation Chahar
Shanghai
Xuzhou
Lanfeng
Wuhan
Nanchang
Changsha
South Guangxi
Guandong Offensive
Chongqing

New features

Construction Group unit allows players to construct small airstrips on locations of their own choosing.

Horses: These brave and loyal animals played a vital role in the war, and are now included in the game as part of Cavalry units and Horse Transportation.

New terrain types: Plow through muddy Rice Fields and fight along the Great Wall of China.

Source: The Publisher Website.

198739.name: Games Cards
198739.description:
Games Cards is a deck of cards in 8 suits. Each suit has 15 cards, numbered from 1 to 15.

Every card presents game, that user owns or has in his wishlist. Every card has rank, suit (type of real game), game weight, number of players and game mechanisms - all of them can be used in dozens of different games with custom rules and for defining what game to play now.

Games for Games Cards system:
- Hockey Cup
- Ludothèque

198740.description:
It is the 1920s, and the world is in a state of confusion following WWI. During this time, you and your friends find yourselves amongst mysterious events. You are surrounded by strange figures, letters with unreadable texts, as well as sudden appearances of being unknown. By relying on your connections, you set out to investigate these incidents. Unknown to you are the frightful truths that lie in wait ahead of you...

Lovecraft Letter is a card game that combines the Love Letter system with the world of H.P. Lovecraft. In addition to the standard sixteen cards in the Love Letter game are new versions of the cards that include special "insanity" powers. If you have one of these cards in your discard pile, then you are insane (at least for the current round) and on future turns can play insanity cards for their regular power or their special power, giving you more options during play. The risk, however, is that you must undergo a sanity check at the start of each of your turns, drawing as many cards from the deck as the number of insanity cards in front of you; draw one or more insanity cards, and you're out for the round.

If you win the game, whether by being the last person standing or the player with the highest single card after the deck runs out, you win a token colored to reflect whether you were sane or insane. Win enough tokens of the right type, and you win the game. Cthluhu can also help you win the game if you release it at the right time...

Will you put an end to the evil schemes as an investigator, or will you help guide the world to destruction as one of insanity's disciples? It all depends on you.

1920年代、世界はいまだ第一次大戦後の混迷の中にあった。そんな折、あなたの身内、あるいは友人が、不可思議な出来事に遭遇する。周囲に現れた奇妙な人影、読めない文字で綴られた手紙、そして、突然の失踪。

あなたは伝手を頼りに、この事件の調査へと乗り出した。その先にどのような恐ろしい事実が待っているかも知らずに……。

本ゲームは、ラブレターのゲームシステムでクトゥルフの世界観を表現したカードゲームです。通常のカードセットに加えて、恐るべき力を持つ狂気カードが新たに導入され、元のゲームとは異なるゲーム展開を楽しむことができます。

探索者として陰謀を未然に防ぐのか、狂気の信徒となって世界を破滅に導くのか。それらは全てあなたの選択次第です。
198740.name: Lovecraft Letter

198741.description: A simplified version of Roll For It, using a single card and 6 dice!
198741.name: Roll For It Express – Watch It Played Promo

198742.name: Briskars
198742.description:
Briskars is a skirmish game taking place in the piracy ages.
Each player builds his band of pirates and chooses among several factions of semi-humans pigs, apes, saurians and more...
The 54 mm miniatures are really beautiful and have to be painted.

Individual games of Briskars are quick and can easily be played in an hour or less , but you can connect them into an ongoing campaign. Many scenarios are given in the rulebook.

198743.name: The Battle for Liege
198743.description:
An alternative opening for the Campaign Game of 1914, Offensive a Outrance, published in C3i magazine Nr.28.

It contains a 4 page booklet (with additional rules and set-up information), 56 die-cut counters and a Game Turn Track extension. The Battle for Liege can be played as a stand-alone scenario.

198744.name: Sailing Down the Kiflan
198744.description:
From publisher blurb:

Winter is coming and one ambitious hajit captain seeks to make one last run before the river ices up.
What can go wrong when all you will do is sail down the Kiflan River?

An adventure written for APLs 3, 5 and 7 (character levels 3-8).

198745.name: One Final Night of Freedom
198745.description:
From publisher blurb:

The ArchDespot settled his affection on Lady Hellebora of House Tioten. The wedding will cement an alliance that will ensure peace for a long time. All the bride needs to do is survive one final night of freedom.

An adventure written for APLs 3, 5 and 7 (character levels 3-8).

198746.name: Minmaxed Monsters
198746.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes the Bad Guys Need Optimization Too!

In conjunction with d20PFSRD.com and Rogue Genius Games, the Four Horsemen bring you their latest release!

Look, we’re not suggestion a GM should have an adversarial relationship with the players. The GM has all the power, and can simply make a monster immune to all attacks and able to kill anything at will. But that’s no FUN, and it’s a great way to drive away players.

Oftentimes the best way to make a villain challenging enough to be fun and memorable is to build both the NPC and the encounters by the rules. The hard part is learning how to optimize within the core system. PCs have the opportunity to finely plan and handcraft characters using a plethora of supplemental source material. The right feat, with the right class, and a mix of archetypes can become a brutal combination. This book is a GM’s guide to doing the same thing, so the player’s are wowed by your cleverly-designed foes.

This way, the GM can tell shocked players an antagonist was made with all core products and is “just fighting smart.” Players who minmax to ruthlessly overcome all challenges have no logical defense for this tactic. It puts the narrative power back where it belongs—in the hands of the GM. Once the GM regains confidence, she can go back to making stories more about intentional sacrifice and watching players work together to overcome a challenge, rather than “losing.”

198747.name: Harrier
198747.description:
From publisher blurb:

Birds of a Feather

A veteran of the Air Force, Curtis Hawkins designed a flying suit that used jet propulsion for thrust and wings for guidance. General Nathan Storm of CASTLE saw the potential of the wings and recruited Curtis as the high-flying Harrier (PL 8). His missions often involve reconnaissance and support of the Sentinels’ operations, including aerial evacuation and tactical support. Curtis is currently petitioning to officially join the Sentinels.

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes what you need is a character everyone will recognize, even if they’ve never met her before.

198748.name: The Tormented (Cavalier/Inquisitor Hybrid)
198748.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forged from the pain of loss, tempered by the flames of vengeance, and bathed in the tears of sorrow. The tormented is a hybrid class, combining the diligence and martial focus of the cavalier with the zeal and determination of the inquisitor. Focusing on her desire to decimate those that have ruined her life, the tormented is the master of vanquishing those that commit the worst of attrocities in life. This supplement also includes three new Orders designed with the tormented in mind.John Buckley

198749.name: Deep Slumber
198749.description:
From publisher blurb:

Feats and plot hooks for the sleep and deep slumber spells.

The Spell Power PDFs introduce two pages of themed content for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Every PDF contains two full pages of high-quality content (no fluff or filler)!

Spell Power: Deep Slumber includes six new feats to be used with the Spell Power modifier as well as plot hooks showing how you can integrate the new powers contained in this tome into your campaign! Check out Dead Slumber, Enchanted Slumber, Fitful Slumber, Selective Slumber, Suspended Slumber, and Potent Slumber!

198750.name: The Stuff of Legends
198750.description:
From publisher blurb:

Backgrounds for Adventurers and Fortune Seekers!

In the world of 5th Edition fantasy, a character’s choice of background represents where he or she came from, and better defines a character’s place and role in the world of the game. Selecting a background provides a player with important hints and clues as to how best to portray their character in action, as well as outfitting the GM with hooks to hang important plot developments on.

Furthermore, a player’s choice of background may equip his or her character with useful skills, proficiencies, and other features as well as providing a basis for his or her personality traits, ideals, bonds, and flaws – all important pieces of the inspiration system. Contained herein are four backgrounds for classical adventuring types: the Knight-Errant, the Legacy’s Heir, the Relic Seeker, and the Treasure Hunter.

198751.name: Curse of Strahd Tarokka Deck
198751.description:
From the Wizards' D&D website:
If you’re playing Curse of Strahd, you’ll want to get your hands on the tarokka deck, a 54-card adventure supplement produced by Gale Force Nine. By using the tarokka deck to randomize locations within the adventure, Dungeon Masters can customize each party’s exploration of Barovia, allowing Curse of Strahd to be replayed for years to come. The deck also includes rules for Prophet's Gambit, a card game for 3-5 players that is listed on BGG.

198752.name: TACTX
198752.description: Each sheet of a pad shows a 15X15 grid in which some square have been blacked out. The location of the black squares differs from grid to grid. Players take turns marking non-black squares, with the objective to get three in a row diagonally or orthogonally and thereby scoring three points. Subsequently adding a square to the row means scoring the entire row again. play until all the squares are filled in.

198753.name: Feats of Psychic Magic
198753.description:
From publisher blurb:

Feats of Psychic Magic is the latest Mythic Mini devoted to exploring the weird word of the occult, from psychic spells to stranger tides on the mental and esoteric planes. If your character is a psychic spellcaster of any sort, she will love the metamagic mayhem and occult oddities she can perform with the secrets found within, with 9 new mythic feats from Hidden Presence and Furious Spell to Traumatic Spell and Manipulative Presence!

198754.name: Marsh Town
198754.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of your towns and cities being boring, bland places in which your PCs show little or no interest? Want to bring them alive with cool, interesting minor features of note? Then Urban Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different kind of town and gives harried GMs the tools to bring such locales to life with interesting and noteworthy features.

This instalment of Urban Dressing presents loads of great details to customise the marsh towns in your campaign. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Urban Dressing: Marsh Town is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

Urban Dressing: Marsh Town presents:

One table (100 entries) presenting the sights and sounds of a marsh town.
One table (100 entries) presenting sample business found in a marsh town.
One table (100 entries) presenting sample folk found in a marsh town.
One table (20 entries) presenting hooks, complications and opportunities.

198755.name: GM's Miscellany: Urban Dressing II (Pathfinder)
198755.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of your towns and cities being boring, bland places in which your PCs show little or no interest? Want to bring them alive with cool, interesting minor features of note? Then Urban Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different kind of town and gives harried GMs the tools to bring such locales to life with interesting and noteworthy features.

This compilation presents loads of great features, NPCs and minor encounters to add to the towns in your campaign. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, GM’s Miscellany: Urban Dressing II is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

198756.name: GM's Miscellany: Urban Dressing II (System Neutral Edition)
198756.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of your towns and cities being boring, bland places in which your PCs show little or no interest? Want to bring them alive with cool, interesting minor features of note? Then Urban Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different kind of town and gives harried GMs the tools to bring such locales to life with interesting and noteworthy features.

This compilation presents loads of great features, NPCs and minor encounters to add to the towns in your campaign. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, GM’s Miscellany: Urban Dressing II is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

198757.name: Kogar
198757.description:
From publisher blurb:

He’s not from around here… Kogar!

A Power Level 12 Renegade, Kogar is an alien bounty hunter with little concern for local law. Kogar is an iconic character in the Beacon City universe, but can be dropped into any campaign with very little alteration.

Kogar’s file is designated "Red" to indicate his powers are innate, but alien. Strong, fast, and skilled in battle, Kogar is a tough visitor to any planet. Unfortunately, he’s not exactly concerned with obeying local customs or checking in with the local law. In fact, he’s not entirely sure what the locals look like, he’s only concerned with tracking down his quarry and cashing them in for a bounty before moving on to his next mission! Any hero who gets in his way will find him occasionally reasonable, but no less annoying for it. On the other hand, his space-ship’s ability to travel anywhere in the known universe might just make him the ally your heroes never knew they needed. For a price.

198758.name: Riders of the Wind
198758.description:
From publisher blurb:

The centaurs make no claim on the Endless Steppe. Rather, they see themselves as its protectors chosen by the spirits of the plains to preserve the lands against the invader, to keep their lands pure, sacred, and free from the rapacious humans who would transform it to suit their needs. Thus the centaurs roam the Steppe, watchful for interlopers from beyond the mountains so they can drive them back as they have so many times before.

This installment in the Poisoned Pages series makes it possible to play centaurs in Shadow of the Demon Lord. A more powerful ancestry than those presented in the main rulebook, centaurs use special rules to make them compatible with other characters in the group

198759.description:
Originally intended as a joke, this alternate design was made into a goodie and was first distributed at Festival International des Jeux in Cannes.

These tokens replace the original "mating action"-tokens.
198759.name: Happy Pigs: Alternate Reproduction Tokens

198760.name: From the Trees
198760.description:
From Introduction:

A clan of Wookiees has relocated to the jungles of Cularin and run afoul of some rather unpleasant natives. Could this be the rumored Wyrd? And if so, can they be stopped? A stand-alone adventure for Living Force heroes levels 1-9. Contains a spoiler for heroes who have not played Force Convention.

198761.name: Paarty On!
198761.description:
From Introduction:

In the midst of a galactic civil war, it’s sometimes hard to find a reason to celebrate. Why does it surprise no one, though, that the Metatheran Cartel has done exactly that? An adventure for 20 or more Living Force heroes of all levels.

198762.name: Who Goes Thaere?
198762.description:
From Introduction:

Cantina brawls, schmoozing information, battling pirates, dealing with the Thaereians, exploring hostile environments, and avoiding being eaten by - well, that would be telling. But it's all in a few days' work, for the heroes of the Cularin system. An adventure for Living Force heroes levels 1-9. This is a stand-alone scenario.

198763.name: Belted In Episode I: Incursion
198763.description:
From Introduction:

The Cularin Militia needs medical supplies. The Thaereian Navy is unwilling to let ships through that bear Militia manifests, and pleas to Senator Wren have gone unanswered. Can the heroes of Cularin make the run? An adventure for LIVING FORCE heroes levels 1-9. This scenario should be played before Excursion and Recursion. This scenario provides opportunities for heroes who have their own ships, but it is not necessary to have your own ship to enjoy it.

198764.name: Belted In Episode II: Excursion
198764.description:
From Introduction:

Several ships have gone missing lately in the Asteroid Belt, including one containing a number of your friends. A rescue mission is planned - but what are those strange, ship-like shadows that keep being spotted in the Belt? An adventure for Living Force heroes levels 1-9. This scenario should be played after Incursion and before Recursion.

198765.name: Belted In Episode III: Recursion
198765.description:
From Introduction:

It's not a calling, and it's not a memory. Something has drawn the heroes of Cularin to the asteroid belt... ever have the feeling you've been here before? An adventure for Living Force heroes levels 1-9. This scenario should be played after Incursion and Excursion.

198766.name: OneDice Urban Fantasy: Underworld
198766.description:
From the introduction:

The PCs are a group of lowlife thugs and criminals who run a pub and club (which they live above) in Not Quite Edinburgh. Aside from running the venue, they deal amphetamines and other drugs to local dealers and bouncers. The gang has steadily grown in influence and wealth and there is no reason for any of the gang to feel dissatisfied.

User summary:

A published tournament module, including optional pre-generated characters.

198767.name: Pin Point!
198767.description: Develop your eagle-eye abilities with Pin Point!! Each card in the deck has several seemingly identical images on it, but in fact only one image is the original one, while all of the other images vary from the original in one way (which means that they vary from each other in two ways). Players race to eliminate all of the variations and point to the original image before anyone else. Claim the most cards, and you win!

198768.name: Night Eyes Episode 1: Night's Promise
198768.description:
From Introduction:

The streets of Cularin have grown progressively less safe over the last two years. Recently, non-Jedi Force-users have been the target of a great deal of distrust - not by the people of Cularin, but by the Thaereian Military. An adventure for Living Force heroes levels 1-9. This scenario should be played before Night’s Friend and Night’s Homecoming.

198769.name: Night Eyes Episode 2: Night's Friend
198769.description:
From Introduction:

The indigent population of Cularin has continued to shrink, with one of the most notable changes being a reduction in the number of children wandering the streets. What is going on? An adventure for Living Force heroes levels 1-9. This scenario should be played after Night's Promise. This trilogy should be played before any Year Four scenarios.

198770.name: The Cloister
198770.description:
From the introduction:

This game is a little different from others. It’s a game in which there are no friends, words, or even a voice. There is a search, it is true but it is quiet and personal.

Think it like a prison, albeit somewhat comfortable...

User summary:

This solitaire game was designed for the Portuguese-language Game Chef 2015 competition. It subsequently was translated into English.

198771.name: Night Eyes Episode 3: Night's Homecoming
198771.description:
From Introduction:

As if the problems with the Thaereians were not already enough, Senator Wren recently made an unscheduled visit to the system, to “speak to my people.” The results are far from what anyone might
have expected.
